0: Captain’s orders: “You don’t put your hands on my flight attendant.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Michael Kerr went ballistic aboard an American Airlines flight from Lexington, Kentucky, to Charlotte, North Carolina, on July 21, threatening and shoving a female flight attendant to the floor before the plane’s pilot grounded him. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The entire inebriated episode was caught on camera. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Just after accepting a proposal to marry his partner and downing three whiskeys, a slurring Kerr is seen disregarding the commands to all passengers by a flight attendant to remain buckled in their seats before deplaning at Charlotte Douglas International Airport at 10:21 a.m. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR As the American Eagle Flight 5039 jet wheeled slowly toward Gate E3, according to the federal complaint filed in the Western District of North Carolina, a stumbling Kerr wobbled down the aisle and demanded VIP treatment to exit. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR With the aircraft’s doors still locked shut, Kerr was rebuffed and “threatened” the flight attendant “by saying that he would break [her] jaw,” the complaint claims. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A video that was published on the Charlotte Observer’s website shows Kerr, with his dark, furry sideburned chops sporting a backward black baseball cap, black T-shirt, low riding jeans, and slinging a backpack off his left shoulder jousting with the pilot, who is only referred to as “N.B.” in the complaint. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “I said take a seat, sir,” the pilot sternly orders Kerr. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “Noooooooo,” the liquored up 36-year-old chef from Lexington told him. “I doooon’t want to take a seat—” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “I don’t care what you want to do, you’re going to take a seat right now,” the pilot shot back. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The video cuts to Kerr getting physical with the flight attendant who is trying to stop him from exiting plane. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “Uh-huh—you’re going to let me by,” Kerr said again, while sandwiched by the flight attendant and swaying in front of the captain. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR On Facebook—just days after the event—the axed chef acted like nothing happened, posting about his future nuptials. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR On July 23, Kerr posted: “Got Engaged to Matthew Stacy.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Whatever happened on the plane clearly didn’t undo Kerr’s romantic life. The assault could leave his future groom at the altar if he is convicted, as Kerr could serve as many as 20 years prison and be fined up to $250,000.
